conclusion: Understanding how shadows change when a light source moves.
Shadows are influenced by the position and size of the light source relative to the objects.
The image shows four objects above slabs casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
The light source is illuminating the objects.
The light source is positioned at the top right of the image.
Shadows will move in the direction of the light source when it moves.
When the light source moves, shadows change in size and position.
Shadows will move closer to or further from the light source depending on its movement.
The shadow of the cake (A) will move closer to the light source.
The shadow of the cake (B) will move further from the light source.
The shadow of the toilet paper roll (C) will move closer to the light source.
The shadow of the ring (D) will move closer to the light source.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadows change in size and position.
Final answer: The shadow of the cake will move closer, the shadow of the toilet paper roll will move closer, and the shadow of the ring will move closer to the light source.
